heroDescription: Gresham, Oregon, a vibrant city near Portland, offers a blend of urban amenities and natural beauty.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 109,397, Gresham is a growing suburb that benefits from proximity to Portland's economic opportunities. The city has a diverse economy, with a focus on retail, healthcare, and manufacturing.
uniqueNeeds: Gresham's growth necessitates infrastructure improvements and affordable housing solutions.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Gresham's retail and healthcare reliance poses risks; diversify investments. Housing market faces affordability issues and potential bubble risks. Flooding is a concern.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Gresham's economy has seen a steady growth rate of 3.2%, driven by local businesses and service sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Gresham is approximately $70,000, reflecting a diverse income range among residents.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Gresham are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and investment diversification.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Gresham's cost of living is about 10% lower than the national average, making it an attractive place for families.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the Gresham housing market is competitive, with home prices rising 8% year-over-year, raising affordability concerns.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Gresham's business climate is favorable, with incentives for small businesses and a supportive local government.
